tweet: Thank you, Rep. @JimLangevin, for signing on to H.R. 1495 to keep community service local. The Trump admin is closing MN’s @NationalService office tomorrow. I urge my colleagues to support national service by putting an end to this ill-conceived plan. https://twitter.com/JimLangevin/status/1123257778842361856?s=20 …

Combating the climate crisis is a moral imperative. For the health of our communities and our planet, we must act now to ensure we live in and leave behind a safer and more sustainable world for future generations. #ClimateHealth2019 #ClimateActionNow pic.twitter.com/ScZlavxUSR

The Johnson O’Malley Act offers programs related to culture, language, & academics for Native students. Last year, I led the passage of its modernization to ensure an accurate count of the of students eligible for these programs. Looking forward to seeing a progress report soon.

I’ve seen the transformative impact of the Tiwahe Initiative within MN’s Red Lake Nation, helping to ensure a comprehensive approach to child, family, and community welfare. BIA must address our concerns to make sure these funds are being distributed properly.
Much more work is needed to fulfill our obligations to Native Americans, and these proposed cuts do not help.
And the administration’s budget proposes a 71 percent reduction in funds for education construction – making it harder to ensure the health and safety of students at Indian school facilities.

The president’s budget proposes eliminating the Tribal Climate Resilience/Cooperative Landscape program that helps tribes combat the effects of climate change on the natural and cultural resources that are so vital to Native livelihood.
Coming up at 10am ET/9am CT →  http://bit.ly/2UO0n0Y  https://twitter.com/BettyMcCollum04/status/1122975883512381440 …

The #TrumpBudget cuts funds for @USIndianAffairs & Bureau of Indian Education by $292 million – making it harder for tribal nations to improve schools, strengthen economies, & maintain safe communities. Watch tomorrow's hearing live at 10am ET/9am CT:  https://bit.ly/2UO0n0Y  pic.twitter.com/r9sgV49mIJ

I was sad to hear of the passing of long-time Indiana Sen. Richard Lugar. I had the chance to work with him on the U.S. Feed the Future initiative; his 36-year Senate career will leave an impact on global affairs for years to come. Sending my condolences to his family & friends.

Play ball! This morning I was honored to be the Grand Marshal for the Highland Ball Parade in St. Paul. More than 500 Little League baseball and softball players marched to Ford Fields for the opening day ceremony. 66 years and Highland Ball is going strong. Have a great season! pic.twitter.com/AupaRb97s2

Since 2000, the measles vaccine has saved over 21 million lives globally. Thanks to the polio vaccine, the US has been polio free since 1979. This #WorldImmunizationWeek, let’s give kids a @ShotAtLife and remind the world that #VaccinesWork pic.twitter.com/NC3dvuadcj

Every two minutes, a child loses their life to malaria.
On #WorldMalariaDay the U.S. must reaffirm its commitment to eradicating malaria by supporting robust global health initiatives in the prevention and treatment of this terrible disease.

On August 27, 1920, 87 St. Paul women made history has the first women in the nation to cast a legal vote after the ratification of the 19th Amendment. Nearly 100 years later, local lawmakers are looking to memorialize this historic moment:  http://lillienews.com/articles/2019/04/15/legislator-looks-memorialize-south-st-paul-voting-history …

It’s wonderful to hear that my dear friend Gordy Kirk was honored by @GovTimWalz during #MNSOTS. Gordy is a WWII veteran who served on the front lines before racial discrimination was banned in the armed forces. He makes our state and our nation proud.

Our state’s favorite comfort food unites Minnesotans from all walks of life. Thank you to @SenTinaSmith for continuing this tradition, and to all of my colleagues for sharing their recipes with us today. And congratulations to my office chefs for their delicious winning recipe!

One of the largest Hmong communities in the U.S. is in MN's 4th Congressional District. I’m so excited that my “Hotdish A-Hmong Friends” recipe took first place today in the 9th annual MN Congressional Delegation Hotdish Competition! pic.twitter.com/mdI6iTzck9

This subcommittee will craft a funding bill that works hard to fulfill our trust & treaty obligations and meet the health needs of Native Americans. The very lives of Native peoples & future generations depend on a strong & robust Indian Health Service.

Native Americans have a shorter life expectancy and suffer from heart disease, cancer, diabetes, obesity & other chronic illnesses at higher rates – yet this administration proposes a budget that is nothing but smoke & mirrors.
The budget request cuts funding for @IHSgov facility programs by $76M, making it harder to repair & improve health care facilities & acquire new medical equipment.

The #TrumpBudget proposal for @IHSgov doesn't even cover the cost of inflation & other fixed costs, and falls far short in addressing the health care needs of Native communities. At 11:30am ET/10:30am CT, we'll ask agency officials about the request →  https://youtu.be/3253IIuL_UM  pic.twitter.com/70U72qjSSO

Seasonal employees are important, but @NatlParkService needs the expertise of permanent, skilled staff – and reducing permanent staff won’t solve the Parks' staffing problems.
 
We can’t run our national parks part-time.

The Texas v. U.S. lawsuit, supported by the Trump admin, would eliminate protections for people with pre-existing conditions & cause millions to lose their care. This is yet another attack on our health care, & House Democrats are voting today to condemn it. #ProtectOurCare pic.twitter.com/mcauyEkEmt

It would eliminate or reduce funding for important research -- including for climate science centers. Reducing investments in climate change research is harmful when we're already feeling its impacts across the country.
The proposed budget would mean fewer Park Rangers to help visitors, fewer resources for protecting natural habitats on our public lands, and fewer resources for endangered species.

.@NatlParkService, @USFWS, and @USGS protect our public lands, natural resources, historic places, and wildlife. It takes 15 months for a woman to earn what a man does in 12, which is why today marks #EqualPayDay. I’m glad to have voted for the #PaycheckFairnessAct -- now the Senate must do the same and finally end pay inequality.

We need to #ProtectCleanWater because every American deserves safe water to drink. For decades, our streams & other water sources have been protected -- but the Trump admin’s #DirtyWaterRule eliminates these safeguards. I’m doing everything I can to fight back. pic.twitter.com/l1KWRwnj0u

We know EPA staff had concerns about the proposed PolyMet mining project in MN – but they weren’t made public. This lack of transparency is unacceptable and just leaves us with more questions. Minnesotans deserve to know the EPA’s concerns.

As my colleague @RepDerekKilmer pointed out, climate change & access to safe drinking water are connected – and ignoring that link while defunding clean water programs puts future generations at risk. #ProtectCleanWater

This 31% cut is the largest proposed cut to any cabinet-level agency. From slashing important research funding, to cutting programs that limit lead exposure in our homes and schools, to funding clean water infrastructure for Indian Country – these cuts harm Americans.

Dedicated EPA employees work hard every day to protect human health & our environment. They’re the defenders of our clean air & clean water. Sadly, the president’s budget completely fails to support the EPA’s mission. The American people deserve better.

Coming up at 10am ET/9am CT: We’ll ask @EPAAWheeler about the #TrumpBudget's massive 31% cut to @EPA – the agency charged with ensuring we have clean air to breathe and safe water to drink. Follow along live here →  https://youtu.be/SK2M6lg47EQ  pic.twitter.com/2F4XsATFbx

Great meeting today with Minnesota Muslim leaders from @CAIRMN, @ISNAHQ and @MASMinnesota advocating for human rights, religious freedom, and ending the Trump admin’s discriminatory Muslim ban. Thanks to @USCMO for their advocacy and leadership. pic.twitter.com/rjK05JG5c7
